column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////Every item I have eaten here has been spot-on. They have the best starter bread I've every had. They somehow manage to keep the butter at literally 1 degree below its melting point
column2: and it goes liquid the second it touches the bread. The iceberg wedge is worth it for the bacon alone
column3: and the goat cheese appetizer is great for sharing. The steaks
column4: from the hanger up to the regular and bone-in ribeyes
column5: have been fantastic and perfectly cooked. The homestyle entrees are excellent
column6: particularly the meatloaf. I've not tried any of the seafood dishes because...Chicago. As for sides
column7: everyone has good reason to rave about the corn
column8: and the creamed spinach and loaded potato are deserving of equal praise.
